title: Benchmarking Online Object Trackers for Underwater Robot Position Locking Applications
author: Ali Safa (Hamad Bin Khalifa University), Waqas Aman (Hamad Bin Khalifa University), Ali Al-Zawqari (Vrije Universiteit Brussels), Saif Al-Kuwari (Hamad Bin Khalifa University), ...
relevance_why: The methodology of robust object tracking proposed for underwater scenarios could inspire similar approaches in audio event tracking or sound source localization tasks, where real-time detection and adaptability to environmental noise are crucial.
background: This work focuses on improving the performance of underwater robots by accurately tracking objects of interest to stabilize their position even under challenging environmental conditions.
contribution: This paper introduces a benchmarking framework for seven machine learning-based object tracking algorithms to solve the problem of underwater robot position locking, demonstrating the strengths and weaknesses of each approach through real-world experiments.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods have primarily focused on object tracking in terrestrial environments, often failing to address the unique underwater challenges like distortion and turbidity.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically evaluates the performance of various tracking algorithms specifically in underwater conditions, offering insights for ROV control.

key_innovation: A comprehensive benchmarking setup for multiple tracking algorithms tailored to the underwater environment, integrating a position-locking system that utilizes real-time adaptations.
real_world_impact: The findings could significantly enhance the operational capabilities of underwater robots in tasks such as inspection and maintenance, potentially leading to more efficient underwater exploration and safety measures.
limitations: No specific limitations are actively mentioned; however, the reliance on a specific dataset may limit generalizability to other underwater environments.

new_terms.Remotely Operated underwater Vehicles (R: **Remotely Operated Underwater Vehicles (ROVs)** are unmanned, remotely controlled submersibles used for underwater exploration and tasks.
new_terms.Proportional-Integral (PI) controller: **Proportional-Integral (PI) controllers** are feedback control systems that combine proportional control, which helps stabilize the system, and integral control, which compensates for past errors to eliminate steady-state errors.

open_sourcing: The dataset acquired during this work is available at https://tinyurl.com/3es8u4dn
